DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the neurotoxicity symptom.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tendency of some treatments to cause damage to the nervous system._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The tendency of some treatments to cause damage to the nervous system.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: A group of neurologic disorders caused by damage to the nervous system following exposure to pharmacologic, biologic, and chemical agents. Examples of neurotoxins include chemotherapy agents, radiation treatment, heavy metals, pesticides, and food additives.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The tendency of some treatments to cause damage to the nervous system._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.

Concepts.definition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The shaking movement of the whole body or just a certain part of it, often caused by problems of the neurons responsible for muscle action.

Concepts.definition: The shaking movement of the whole body or just a certain part of it, often caused by problems of the neurons responsible for muscle action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change to an individual's judgment, orientation (to place, time, and self), intellectual functioning, or mood from their baseline.

Concepts.definition: A change to an individual's judgment, orientation (to place, time, and self), intellectual functioning, or mood from their baseline.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

PermissibleValues.value: Hemiparesis or other focal motor deficit
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hemiparesis Or Other Focus Motor Deficit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hemiparesis Or Other Focus Motor Deficit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.: Loss of movement function.

Concepts.definition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.
Loss of movement function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Optical perception of an object, person or event in the absence of a corresponding stimulus.

Concepts.definition: Optical perception of an object, person or event in the absence of a corresponding stimulus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: White matter changes first described in children with leukaemia, associated with radiation and chemotherapy injury, often associated with methotrexate; pathologically characterised by diffuse reactive astrocytosis with multiple areas of necrotic foci without inflammation. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: White matter changes first described in children with leukemia, associated with radiation and chemotherapy injury, often associated with methotrexate; pathologically characterised by diffuse reactive astrocytosis with multiple areas of necrotic foci without inflammation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A false sensory perception in the absence of an external stimulus, as distinct from an illusion which is a misperception of an external stimulus.

Concepts.definition: A false sensory perception in the absence of an external stimulus, as distinct from an illusion which is a misperception of an external stimulus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Impairment of verbal communication skills, often resulting from brain damage.

Concepts.definition: Impairment of verbal communication skills, often resulting from brain damage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond.

Concepts.definition: A neurologic state characterized by decreased ability to perceive and respond.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the brain.

Concepts.definition: Swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the brain.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hemiparesis Or Paraparesis Or Other Motor Deficit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hemiparesis Or Paraparesis Or Other Motor Deficit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A slight paralysis or weakness of both legs.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Loss of movement function.

Concepts.definition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term referring to disorders characterized by the disruption of normal speech. It includes stuttering, lisps, dysarthria and voice disorders.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to disorders characterized by the disruption of normal speech. It includes stuttering, lisps, dysarthria and voice disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A noticeable change in a person's behavior and thinking. Causes include depression, drug or alcohol abuse, brain injuries, brain tumors, and Alzheimer's disease.

Concepts.definition: A noticeable change in a person's behavior and thinking. Causes include depression, drug or alcohol abuse, brain injuries, brain tumors, and Alzheimer's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An efferent neuron that sends impulses from the central nervous system to skeletal muscles.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: An efferent neuron that sends impulses from the central nervous system to skeletal muscles.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

Concepts.definition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diminished mental function.

Concepts.definition: Diminished mental function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._An inflammatory process affecting the brain parenchyma. Causes include viral infections and less frequently bacterial infections, toxins, and immune-mediated processes.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
An inflammatory process affecting the brain parenchyma. Causes include viral infections and less frequently bacterial infections, toxins, and immune-mediated processes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

Concepts.definition: A group of neurologic disorders caused by damage to the nervous system following exposure to pharmacologic, biologic, and chemical agents. Examples of neurotoxins include chemotherapy agents, radiation treatment, heavy metals, pesticides, and food additives.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
